intro: Tabernaemontana umbrosa, commonly known as the dark tabernanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, attracting pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Tabernaemontana umbrosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
